Comments_List: I had never taken a History of Art course before, and as a first foray, this class provided an entirely new way of looking at art, architecture, history, and religion.

This is amazing course that explores a fascinating subject matter. The class developed the students' abilities to create arguments from visual analysis  specifically, a more complete argument in a longer final paper that drew from the methods we practiced in class every week. The class' inclusion of a presentation on our final project research before the final paper was such an important step that helped the writing process so much (a method of thinking that I will bring to other classes).
scholarship and approaches to medieval art history
Strengths: good, not excruciating workload. Very chill - really conducive to actual learning. Lots of awesome lecture, which is how I learn best. Good discussion too.

This course's strengths completely depend on the attitude you bring to class, but the small size of the seminar means that you have an astounding set of opportunities to learn through conversation with Professor Jung and from your peers. If this course has any weaknesses, they stem from the limited nature of the syllabus, but maybe limited is the wrong word. We study exactly one work of art per week, which makes it feel like we only scratch the surface. However, the degree of granularity with which we assess each piece and the scholarship surrounding it almost makes up for the narrow scope.

This course was planned excellently with topics to focus on each week and an interesting array of reading for each class meeting. Professor Jung led the seminar very well and really welcomed students into the conversation and encouraged them to think critically and speak up.

strengths- time and scope to allow for tailored engagement with medieval art, room to explore diverse interests
weaknesses- better time management/pacing
Absolutely. Good, traditional, classical academia - my favorite.

This class is awesome. Professor Jung is a genius, and the works of art you deal with are super fun and exciting. The workload is completely manageable (just weekly readings and one final paper) and even if you've never taken a History of Art class before (which I hadn't), it has a lot to offer.
This is an amazing course that I would definitely recommend!
yes, this was a great medieval art class
